summary: This is a July 2, 2020 press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell. It charges her with conspiracy with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, including enticing and transporting minors, and with perjury in 2016 depositions. The release details the alleged grooming and abuse scheme spanning from 1994 to 1997 across multiple locations.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, facilitating the grooming and abuse of victims as young as 14, and committing perjury in 2016 depositions.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier alleged to have sexually abused minor girls with the assistance of Ghislaine Maxwell between 1994 and 1997.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued the press release and made a statement condemning Maxwell's alleged role in facilitating and participating in the sexual abuse of minors.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.role: Assistant Director-in-Charge of the FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: Made a statement praising the bravery of the victims and condemning Maxwell's and Epstein's actions for exploiting vulnerable youth.

persons.name: Dermot Shea
persons.role: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department (NYPD)
persons.context: Made a statement commending investigators and partners for their commitment to bringing justice to survivors of sexual assault.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Assigned to preside over Ghislaine Maxwell's case.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse minor girls from at least 1994 to 1997.
Maxwell is alleged to have facilitated, aided, and participated in Epstein's sexual abuse of minor victims, and in some cases participated in the abuse herself.

events.title: Arrest and Indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and a federal indictment was unsealed charging her with conspiracy with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors and with perjury.

events.title: Alleged Abuse Scheme
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein allegedly exploited girls as young as 14, enticing them to travel to various residences for the purpose of sexual abuse.

events.title: False Deposition Testimony
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell allegedly made several false statements under oath during depositions in a civil proceeding.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors.
The indictment alleges the abuse scheme operated from at least 1994 to 1997, targeting victims as young as 14 years old.
Maxwell is accused of playing a critical role in grooming victims by befriending them, taking them on trips, and normalizing sexual interactions with Epstein.
The alleged abuse occurred at Epstein's residences in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, as well as at Maxwell's residence in London.
Maxwell is also charged with two counts of perjury for false statements made under oath in 2016 depositions.
